TopicTitle: Please suggest a visual mod that is not very memory/CPU hungry.

Articles.Content:
I grew tired of boring cloudless skies and dark lifeless night-time Kerbin and considering between several mods that add to awesomeness of planets and skies. The only thing that stops me is that my computer is not all that fast and I don't want to turn my game into a slideshow. So, the question is - which visual mod, you think, provides the best visual experience and is not very demanding to memory/processing power at the same time?

What I mean - I run a heavily modded install and I would prefer some functional mods over visual ones if I had to choose. Still I might appreciate better visuals if I can afford it.

E.V.E would be less memory used, I would think http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-24-7-4-Sep-9-2014-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements and then you have the heavier ones like Astronomer's Visual Pack http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145-0-25-Astronomer-s-Visual-Pack-Interstellar-V2 and just alittle better on memory the Astronomer's Visual Pack you have KSPRC http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76972-0-25-KSPRC-Renaissance-Compilation-artworks-remake-V-0-1-9-%2803-11-14%29.

EDIT- O yes Planetshine and Distant Object Enhancement as Algiark posted is a must install

Planetshine http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96497-0-25-0-90-PlanetShine-v0-2-2-1

Distant Object Enhancement http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98943-0-90-Distant-Object-Enhancement-bis-v1-5-1-%2821-Dec-2014%29

Edited January 15, 2015 by Mecripp2
Planetshine, Ambient Light Adjustment, Distant Object Enhancement, a new skybox for Texture Replacer perhaps?
